name: Lazarus Group NineRAT
description: Tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) of the Lazarus Group used in their recent campaign with NineRAT malware

techniques.comment: NineRAT malware uses Telegram as a Command and Control (C2) channel to evade network and host-based detection measures
The Lazarus Group used PowerShell and cmd.exe to run commands for the initial reconnaissance and later stages of the attack
The Lazarus used a modular infection chain with different components to achieve defense evasion and functional separation
The Lazarus used a modular infection chain with different components to achieve defense evasion and functional separation
Lazarus exploited Log4j (CVE-2021-44228) to gain initial access
The Lazarus Group created a new user account and granted it administrative privileges
Laazrus used credential dumping utilities like ProcDump and MimiKatz
During the initial reconnaissance, Lazarus used several commands to gather system information. Later, NineRAT was used to finger-print the systems
Lazarus used the 'net group /domain Domain Computers' command during network reconnaissance
The NineRAT RAT sent stolen data to the C2 server via an encrypted channel (Telegram)
Lazarus used the 'getmac' command to discover remote systems on the network
NineRAT ran the WMIC command to discover anti-virus products on the system
Lazarus used the 'tasklist' command to discover running processes on the system
Lazarus used several commands like procdump.exe and pwdump.exe to dump credentials from the OS
